problem.display_name: What can basic questions not help you with?

label.strong: If you were a basic question, what would you NOT be good at?

multiplechoiceresponse.description: Select one answer from the list below.

choicegroup.choice: Helping learners feel they are getting individualised support At a basic level, hints and prompts can certainly help you achieve this. Other techniques, such as using an adaptive design, can be helpful but try basic methods first!
Mathematical assessment where there might be a range of answers Basic questions can be set up to allow numerical tolerances
Looking after the cat when you're away That's right! *phew* The cat looks less tense now ;)
Helping to mitigate cheating in assessments You can't guarentee no cheating in any assessment but you can certainly make it harder for them! This is possible with basic question setup
Mixing up the order of questions and their answers to keep things fresh Random ordering is possible, freshness can't be guarenteed!

demandhint.hint: Sometimes a little nudge is all you need. Although, cats typically need food and water if you're going away
The cat is the only one judging.
